00124 struct win_window *wtk_gauge_as_child(struct wtk_gauge *gauge)
00125 {
00126         assert(gauge);

00141 bool wtk_gauge_set_value(struct wtk_gauge *gauge, uint8_t value)
00142 {
00143         uint8_t length;
00144         uint8_t option;
00145         uint8_t maximum;
00146         struct win_area const *area;
00147 
00148         assert(gauge);
00149         assert(value <= gauge->maximum);
00150 
00151         if (value != gauge->value) {
00152                 gauge->value = value;
00153                 option = gauge->option;
00154                 maximum = gauge->maximum;
00155                 area = win_get_area(gauge->container);
00156 
00157                 
00158                 length = area->size.x;
00159                 
00160 
00161                 length -= 2;
00162 
00163                 if (option & WTK_GAUGE_INVERT) {
00164                         value = maximum - value;
00165                 }
00166 
00167                 gauge->position = wtk_rescale_value(value, maximum, length);
00168                 win_redraw(gauge->container);
00169 
00170                 return true;
00171 
00172         } else {
00173                 return false;
00174         }
00175 }

00206  uint8_t wtk_gauge_trigtable(uint8_t angle)
00207 {
00208         return progmem_read8(&(trigtable[angle]));

00246 static bool wtk_gauge_handler(struct win_window *win,
00247                 enum win_event_type type, void const *data)
00248 {
00249         struct win_clip_region const    *clip;
00250         struct win_area const           *area;
00251         struct wtk_gauge                *gauge;
00252         uint8_t                         position;
00253         uint8_t                         option;
00254 
00255 
00256 
00257         gauge = (struct wtk_gauge *)win_get_custom_data(win);
00258 
00259         // Window receiving the event should be the widget's containing window.
00260         assert(win == gauge->container);
00261 
00262         switch (type) {
00263         case WIN_EVENT_DRAW:
00264                 /* For DRAW events, the data parameter points to the clipping
00265                  * region. The window area parameter is needed because it
00266                  * contains the size of the widget.
00267                  */
00268                 clip = (struct win_clip_region const *)data;
00269                 area = win_get_area(win);
00270 
00271                 position = gauge->position;
00272                 option = gauge->option;
00273 
00274 
00275                 /*
00276                 * !! GAUGE !! 
00277                 *
00278                 * Draw gauge!
00279                 *
00280                 * Need to define more external colors
00281                 * 
00282                 */
00283                 
00284                 
00285         /* New gauge bit option, for drawing different gauges
00286          * Yet to be implemented!
00287          */
00288         if (option & WTK_GAUGE_CIRCLE) {
00289         
00290         }
00291                 
00292         else {
00293                 
00294         
00295         
00296         /* Erases the previous gauge line using old x\y values, 
00297          * not enabled at first draw event
00298          */
00299                 if (!gauge->start&gauge->solidbg) {
00301                         gfx_generic_draw_line(
00302                                 clip->origin.x + gauge->xrescale + 
00303                                         area->size.x / 7,
00304                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 
00305                                         gauge->yrescale - 3,
00306                                 clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 3 - 
00307                                         area->size.x / 3 + gauge->x2rescale,
00308                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 3 - 
00309                                         gauge->y2rescale,
00310                                 gauge->background_color);
00311         
00313                         gfx_generic_draw_line(
00314                                 clip->origin.x + gauge->xrescale + 
00315                                         area->size.x / 7 + 1,
00316                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 
00317                                         gauge->yrescale - 3,
00318                                 clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 3 - 
00319                                         area->size.x / 3 + gauge->x2rescale + 1,
00320                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 3 - 
00321                                         gauge->y2rescale,
00322                                 gauge->background_color);
00324                         gfx_generic_draw_line(
00325                                 clip->origin.x + gauge->xrescale + 
00326                                         area->size.x / 7,
00327                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 
00328                                         gauge->yrescale - 3 + 1,
00329                                 clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 3 - 
00330                                         area->size.x / 3 + gauge->x2rescale,
00331                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 3 - 
00332                                         gauge->y2rescale + 1,
00333                                 gauge->background_color);
00334                 }
00335                 
00336                 
00338                 if (gauge->start&gauge->solidbg) {
00339                 
00341                         gfx_draw_rect(clip->origin.x, clip->origin.y, 
00342                                 area->size.x, area->size.y, 
00343                                 WTK_PROGRESS_BAR_BORDER_COLOR);
00344                                 
00345                         gfx_draw_filled_rect(clip->origin.x,
00346                                 clip->origin.y,
00347                                 area->size.x - 2,
00348                                 area->size.y - 2,
00349                                 GFX_COLOR(77, 77, 77));
00350                                 
00351                                 
00352                         /* Draws gauge track circle in quadrant 1 */
00354                         gfx_draw_circle(clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 2,
00355                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 2,
00356                                 area->size.x - 2,
00357                                 GFX_COLOR(0, 0, 0), GFX_QUADRANT1);
00359                         gfx_draw_filled_circle(clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 2,
00360                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 2,
00361                                 area->size.x - 3,
00362                                 gauge->background_color, GFX_QUADRANT1);
00364                         gfx_draw_circle(clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 2,
00365                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 2,
00366                                 area->size.x / 3 - 2,
00367                                 GFX_COLOR(0, 0, 0), GFX_QUADRANT1);
00369                         gfx_draw_filled_circle(clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 2,
00370                                 clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 2,
00371                                 area->size.x / 3 - 3,
00372                                 GFX_COLOR(150, 150, 150), GFX_QUADRANT1);
00373                                 
00374                         /* Sets start to false so the background draw is halted 
00375                          * and enables the gauge line erase function for next 
00376                          * draw event
00377                          */
00378                         gauge->start = false;
00379                 }
00380                 
00382                 if(!gauge->solidbg) {
00383 
00384                 }
00385                 
00386 
00387                 
00388                 /* Rescales the position value for accessing 
00389                  * data in the trigtable array
00390                 */
00391                 
00392                 gauge->rescale = wtk_rescale_value(position, 
00393                         area->size.x - 2, 127);
00394                 
00395                 
00396                 
00398                 gauge->xangle = 255 - progmem_read8(&
00399                         (trigtable[127 - gauge->rescale]));
00400                         
00402                 gauge->yangle = progmem_read8(&(trigtable[gauge->rescale]));
00403                                 
00404                 /* Rescales the first x trigonometric value for 
00405                  * usage in the draw function
00406                  */
00407                 gauge->xrescale = wtk_rescale_value(gauge->xangle, 255, 
00408                         area->size.x - 3 - area->size.x / 7);
00409                 
00410                 /* Rescales the first y trigonometric value for usage in the 
00411                  * draw function
00412                  */
00413                 gauge->yrescale = wtk_rescale_value(gauge->yangle, 255, 
00414                         area->size.y - 3 - area->size.x / 7);
00415                 
00416                 /* Rescales the second x trigonometric value for usage in the 
00417                  * draw function
00418                  */
00419                 gauge->x2rescale = wtk_rescale_value(gauge->xangle, 255, 
00420                         area->size.x / 3);
00421                 
00422                 /* Rescales the second y trigonometric value for usage in the 
00423                  * draw function
00424                  */
00425                 gauge->y2rescale = wtk_rescale_value(gauge->yangle, 255, 
00426                         area->size.y / 3);
00427                 
00428 
00430                 gfx_generic_draw_line(clip->origin.x + gauge->xrescale + 
00431                         area->size.x / 7,
00432                         clip->origin.y + area->size.y - gauge->yrescale - 3,
00433                         clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 3 - area->size.x / 3 + 
00434                                 gauge->x2rescale,
00435                         clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 3 - gauge->y2rescale,
00436                         GFX_COLOR(200, 0, 0));
00437                 
00439                 gfx_generic_draw_line(clip->origin.x + gauge->xrescale + 
00440                                 area->size.x / 7 + 1,
00441                         clip->origin.y + area->size.y - gauge->yrescale - 3,
00442                         clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 3 - area->size.x / 3 + 
00443                                 gauge->x2rescale + 1,
00444                         clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 3 - gauge->y2rescale,
00445                         gauge->fill_color);
00446                 
00448                 gfx_generic_draw_line(clip->origin.x + gauge->xrescale + 
00449                                 area->size.x / 7,
00450                         clip->origin.y + area->size.y - gauge->yrescale - 3 + 1,
00451                         clip->origin.x + area->size.x - 3 - area->size.x / 3 + 
00452                                 gauge->x2rescale,
00453                         clip->origin.y + area->size.y - 3 - gauge->y2rescale + 1,
00454                         GFX_COLOR(170, 0, 0));
00455                 
00456                 
00457                 /* Positions Xplained!
00458                  * clip->origin.(x\y)                               
00459                  * -- the frames start position top left cord(0.0) - start pixel
00460                  * area->size.(x\y)                                 
00461                  * -- the area size aquired from area defined in widget
00462                  * clip->origin.(x\y) + area.size.(x\y) - 1               
00463                  * -- the frames right bottom corner - end pixel
00464                  * clip->origin.(x\y) (+ 1)(+ area->size.y - 3)     
00465                  * -- the gauges start position 
00466                  */
00467 
00468 
00469                 /* Always accept DRAW events, as the return value is ignored
00470                  * anyway for that event type.
00471                  */
00472                  }
00473                 return true;
00474 
00475         case WIN_EVENT_DESTROY:
00476                 /* Free up all memory allocated by widget.
00477                  * The window is freed by the window system
00478                  */
00479                 membag_free(gauge);
00480                 return true;
00481 
00482         default:
00483                 return false;
00484         }
00485 }

00522 struct wtk_gauge *wtk_gauge_create(struct win_window *parent,
00523                 struct win_area const *area, struct gfx_bitmap *background, 
00524                 uint8_t maximum, uint8_t value, gfx_color_t fill_color, 
00525                 gfx_color_t background_color, 
00526                 gfx_color_t parent_background_color, uint8_t option)
00527 {
00528         uint8_t length;
00529 
00530         // Do sanity check on parameters.
00531         assert(maximum > 0);
00532         assert(value <= maximum);
00533         assert(area);
00534         assert(parent);
00535 
00536         // Attributes scratchpad.
00537         struct win_attributes attr;
00538 
00539         // Allocate memory for the control data.
00540         struct wtk_gauge *gauge =
00541                         membag_alloc(sizeof(struct wtk_gauge));
00542         if (!gauge) {
00543                 goto outofmem_gauge;
00544         }
00545 
00546         // Initialize the gauge data.
00547         gauge->maximum = maximum;
00548         gauge->value = value;
00549         gauge->option = option;
00550         gauge->start = true;
00551 
00552         /* Set the gauge's colors
00553          * 
00554          */
00555          
00556         gauge->fill_color = fill_color;
00557                 
00558         gauge->background_color = background_color;
00559         
00560         gauge->parent_background_color = parent_background_color;
00561         
00562         if (option & WTK_GAUGE_INVERT) {
00563                 value = maximum - value;
00564         }
00565 
00566         // Set up handling information.
00567         attr.event_handler = wtk_gauge_handler;
00568         attr.custom = gauge;
00569 
00570         /* Do sanity check of specified window area parameters
00571          * according to the orientation of the gauge.
00572          */
00573         attr.area = *area;
00574         assert(attr.area.size.x > 3);
00575         assert(attr.area.size.y > 3);
00576 
00577 
00578         assert(attr.area.size.x < (uint8_t) ~ 0);
00579         length = attr.area.size.x;
00580 
00581 
00582         length -= 2;
00583 
00584         // Set the gauge's end position.
00585         gauge->position = wtk_rescale_value(value, maximum, length);
00586 
00587         // Set background for gauge window
00588         if (background) {
00589                 // solid background bitmap
00590                 attr.background = NULL;
00591                 attr.behavior = 0;
00592                 gauge->solidbg = true;
00593         } else {
00594                 // transparent, redraw parent
00595                 attr.background = NULL;
00596                 attr.behavior = WIN_BEHAVIOR_REDRAW_PARENT;
00597                 gauge->solidbg = false;
00598         }
00599 
00600         // Create a new window for the gauge.
00601         gauge->container = win_create(parent, &attr);
00602         if (!gauge->container) {
00603                 goto outofmem_container;
00604         }
00605 
00606         return gauge;
00607 
00608     outofmem_container:
00609         membag_free(gauge);
00610 
00611     outofmem_gauge:
00612         return NULL;
00613 }
